info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Hanover and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over over Leland. This storm was slowly drifting west. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leland, Northwest, Batarora, Phoenix, Belville, Navassa and Sandy Creek. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 39 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
